conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, i.e., a = dv/dt.
On a v-t graph, the acceleration at any point is represented by the slope of the tangent to the curve at that point.
If the slope is increasing, the acceleration is increasing. If the slope is decreasing, the acceleration is decreasing.
The graph for object A shows a parabolic curve that rises to a peak and then falls.
The red line represents the tangent to the curve at point A, which is somewhere on the rising portion of the parabola.
